intro: Phalacroloma annuum, commonly known as the annual phalacroloma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and erect. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
